verses.verse: Now after this <WH310> it came to pass, that David <WH1732> smote <WH5221> the Philistines <WH6430>, and subdued <WH3665> them, and took <WH3947> Gath <WH1661> and her towns <WH1323> out of the hand <WH3027> of the Philistines <WH6430>.
And he smote <WH5221> Moab <WH4124>; and the Moabites <WH4124> became David's <WH1732> servants <WH5650>, and brought <WH5375> gifts <WH4503>.

And David <WH1732> smote <WH5221> Hadarezer <WH1928> king <WH4428> of Zobah <WH6678> unto Hamath <WH2574>, as he went <WH3212> to stablish <WH5324> his dominion <WH3027> by the river <WH5104> Euphrates <WH6578>. Hadarezer: or, Hadadezer

And David <WH1732> took <WH3920> from him a thousand <WH505> chariots <WH7393>, and seven <WH7651> thousand <WH505> horsemen <WH6571>, and twenty <WH6242> thousand <WH505> footmen <WH376> <WH7273>: David <WH1732> also houghed <WH6131> all the chariot <WH7393> horses, but reserved <WH3498> of them an hundred <WH3967> chariots <WH7393>. seven: or, seven hundred

And when the Syrians <WH758> of Damascus <WH1834> came <WH935> to help <WH5826> Hadarezer <WH1928> king <WH4428> of Zobah <WH6678>, David <WH1732> slew <WH5221> of the Syrians <WH758> two <WH8147> and twenty <WH6242> thousand <WH505> men <WH376>. Damascus: Heb. Darmesek

Then David <WH1732> put <WH7760> garrisons in Syriadamascus <WH758> <WH1834>; and the Syrians <WH758> became David's <WH1732> servants <WH5650>, and brought <WH5375> gifts <WH4503>. Thus the LORD <WH3068> preserved <WH3467> David <WH1732> whithersoever he went <WH1980>.
And David <WH1732> took <WH3947> the shields <WH7982> of gold <WH2091> that were on the servants <WH5650> of Hadarezer <WH1928>, and brought <WH935> them to Jerusalem <WH3389>.

Likewise from Tibhath <WH2880>, and from Chun <WH3560>, cities <WH5892> of Hadarezer <WH1928>, brought <WH3947> David <WH1732> very <WH3966> much <WH7227> brass <WH5178>, wherewith Solomon <WH8010> made <WH6213> the brasen <WH5178> sea <WH3220>, and the pillars <WH5982>, and the vessels <WH3627> of brass <WH5178>. Tibhath: called in the book of Samuel Betah, and Berothai

Now when Tou <WH8583> king <WH4428> of Hamath <WH2574> heard <WH8085> how David <WH1732> had smitten <WH5221> all the host <WH2428> of Hadarezer <WH1928> king <WH4428> of Zobah <WH6678>; Tou: also called, Toi

He sent <WH7971> Hadoram <WH1913> his son <WH1121> to king <WH4428> David <WH1732>, to enquire <WH7592> of his welfare <WH7965>, and to congratulate <WH1288> him, because he had fought <WH3898> against Hadarezer <WH1928>, and smitten <WH5221> him; (for Hadarezer <WH1928> had war <WH376> <WH4421> with Tou <WH8583>;) and with him all manner of vessels <WH3627> of gold <WH2091> and silver <WH3701> and brass <WH5178>. Hadoram: also called, Joram to enquire: or, to salute to congratulate: Heb. to bless had war: Heb. was the man of wars

Them also king <WH4428> David <WH1732> dedicated <WH6942> unto the LORD <WH3068>, with the silver <WH3701> and the gold <WH2091> that he brought <WH5375> from all these nations <WH1471>; from Edom <WH123>, and from Moab <WH4124>, and from the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>, and from the Philistines <WH6430>, and from Amalek <WH6002>.

Moreover Abishai <WH52> the son <WH1121> of Zeruiah <WH6870> slew <WH5221> of the Edomites <WH123> in the valley <WH1516> of salt <WH4417> eighteen <WH8083> <WH6240> thousand <WH505>. Abishai: Heb. Abshai

And he put <WH7760> garrisons <WH5333> in Edom <WH123>; and all the Edomites <WH123> became David's <WH1732> servants <WH5650>. Thus the LORD <WH3068> preserved <WH3467> David <WH1732> whithersoever he went <WH1980>.
So David <WH1732> reigned <WH4427> over all Israel <WH3478>, and executed <WH6213> judgment <WH4941> and justice <WH6666> among all his people <WH5971>.
And Joab <WH3097> the son <WH1121> of Zeruiah <WH6870> was over the host <WH6635>; and Jehoshaphat <WH3092> the son <WH1121> of Ahilud <WH286>, recorder <WH2142>. recorder: or, remembrancer

And Zadok <WH6659> the son <WH1121> of Ahitub <WH285>, and Abimelech <WH40> the son <WH1121> of Abiathar <WH54>, were the priests <WH3548>; and Shavsha <WH7798> was scribe <WH5608>; Abimelech: called Ahimelech Sam. Shavsha: called Seraiah in Sam. and Shisha, I. King.4.2.

And Benaiah <WH1141> the son <WH1121> of Jehoiada <WH3077> was over the Cherethites <WH3774> and the Pelethites <WH6432>; and the sons <WH1121> of David <WH1732> were chief <WH7223> about <WH3027> the king <WH4428>. about: Heb. at the hand of the king
